meanings.definition: To settle in a new place
meanings.sent1: After the flood, the family had to resettle in a different town.
meanings.sent2: Many refugees have to resettle in foreign countries to find safety.
meanings.sent3: The birds decided to resettle in a tree with better branches for their nests.
meanings.sent4: The idea of starting fresh and resettling in a new city excited her.
meanings.sent5: The nomadic tribe would resettle every few months to find better grazing lands.

meanings.definition: To establish in a new location
meanings.sent1: The company plans to resettle its headquarters in a more central area.
meanings.sent2: They had to resettle the ancient artifacts in a new museum for better preservation.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to resettle their colony closer to the food source.
meanings.sent4: The decision to resettle the garden in a sunnier spot improved the plant growth.
meanings.sent5: The settlers had to resettle their crops after the unexpected storm destroyed their fields.

meanings.definition: To move and live in a new place
meanings.sent1: The family had to resettle in a different country due to political unrest.
meanings.sent2: People often resettle in warmer climates after retiring.
meanings.sent3: The idea to resettle in a treehouse seemed adventurous but impractical.
meanings.sent4: She decided to resettle in the bustling city to pursue her career.
meanings.sent5: The decision to resettle in the mountains brought them closer to nature.
